questions.question: What answer best describes the purpose of the scientific method?

choices.answer: To solve problems and create experiments.

questions.question: What is a hypothesis?

choices.answer: What you keep the same in an experiment.

questions.question: What's the hypothesis for "Does playing violent video games lead to higher blood pressure?"

choices.answer: Playing violent video games gives people higher blood pressure.
If you play violent video games you will have higher blood pressure.
If you have higher blood pressure, then you play violent video games.
If you play violent video games, then you will have higher blood pressure.

questions.question: Why is the following hypothesis considered a bad hypothesis? "Plants not given fertilizer will grow taller."

choices.answer: It is not written in the "if" and "then" format
The independent and dependent variables are in the wrong order

questions.question: What is an independent variable?

choices.answer: What is measured in an experiment
What stays the same in an experiment
What you change in an experiment

questions.question: What is the independent variable in this question? "What brand of popcorn pops the most kernels?"

choices.answer: how long it takes the kernels to pop

questions.question: What is a dependent variable?

choices.answer: What is measured in an experiment
What stays the same in an experiment
What you change in an experiment

questions.question: What is the dependent variable in this question? "What brand of popcorn pops the most kernels?"

choices.answer: how long it takes the kernels to pop

questions.question: What is the main reason scientists have constants or controlled variables?

choices.answer: So they know their results came only from the independent variable
So scientists can record data easier
So the experiment is clear and easy to understand

questions.question: Identify a constant or controlled variable in this experiment: "Do plants grow faster in the shade?"

choices.answer: The amount of water each plant gets

questions.question: What does a good scientific question need to have?

choices.answer: It needs to have an indpendent variable
It needs to have a dependent variable
All of the choices are needed

questions.question: What is a qualitative observation?

choices.answer: A guess you make using an observation
What is kept the same in an experiment

questions.question: What is a quantitative observation?

choices.answer: A guess you make using an observation
What is kept the same in an experiment

questions.question: What is an inference?

choices.answer: A guess you make using an observation
What is kept the same in an experiment

questions.question: What is the main reason scientists conduct research?

choices.answer: So they don't have to do experiments
To learn more info about their topic before they conduct an experiment
So they stay up to date on the world around them

questions.question: What is a procedure?

choices.answer: What stays the same in an experiement

questions.question: What is the term used when another scientist does someone's experiment to see if results are valid?
Jackie goes to Silver River each week for 4 weeks and collects 5 samples of water to test the pH. What is she doing?
Scientists may use all of the steps of the scientific method in order, but often they may skip some or change order.
Why do scientists have MANY trials with their experiments?
